section.p: Episode observations are used to distinguish among multiple occurrences of a problem or social history item. An episode observation is used to indicate that a problem act represents a new episode, distinct from other episodes of a similar concern.

ol.li: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass) (CONF-170)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood) (CONF-171)
SHOULD contain exactly one [1..1] code/@code="ASSERTION" (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.4 HL7ActCode) (CONF-174)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] statusCode/@code="completed" (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.14 HL7ActStatus) (CONF-172, CONF-173)
SHOULD contain exactly one [1..1] value/@code="404684003" Clinical finding (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96 SNOMEDCT), where its data type is CD (CONF-175)

Value in an episode observation SHOULD be the following SNOMED CT expression: <codeblock><value xsi:type="CD" code="404684003" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" displayName="Clinical finding"> <qualifier> <name code="246456000" displayName="Episodicity"/> <value code="288527008" displayName="New episode"/> </qualifier> </value></codeblock> (CONF-175)
SHALL satisfy: Source of exactly one entryRelationship whose typeCode is 'SUBJ'. This is used to link the episode observation to the target problem act or social history observation. (CONF-176)

Source of one or more entryRelationship whose typeCode is 'SAS'. The target of the entryRelationship SHALL be a problem act or social history observation. This is used to represent the temporal sequence of episodes. (CONF-177)
